title: Lea Michele lists the Los Angeles bachelorette pad where she healed after Cory Monteith died
text:
Advertisement

Hollywood favorite Lea Michele has listed her stunning Los Angeles home.

The 33-year-old Scream Queens actress first listed the white, breezy dwelling for $3.35 in a small 'pocket listing' but then relisted it to be seen by all with a new price tag of $3.15M, according to Variety.

The Brunette Bombshell author - who hails from the Bronx and got her start on Broadway - purchased the stunning 3,163-square-foot home in 2015 for under $3M.

A very dreamy place to call home: Hollywood favorite Lea Michele has listed her stunning Los Angeles house

Dazzling in her gown: The siren was last seen at the AmFAR event in Los Angeles on Thursday evening

The Glee star once called the residence 'healing' as she stayed there after recovering from the shock 2013 death of her boyfriend Cory Monteith, who worked with her on Glee.

It's located in Brentwood's Mandeville Canyon area where Reese Witherspoon and Gwyneth Paltrow have homes.

The canyon is deep and filled with mansions that can cost up to $40M. The area is about three miles from the beach.

Big money: The 33-year-old Scream Queens actress first listed the white, breezy dwelling for $3.35 in a small 'pocket listing'

A price decrease of $200,000: But then Lea relisted it to be seen by all with a new price tag of $3.15M

At rest: Lea has shared many images from her home on social media. On the left she is seen in front of her fireplace. And on the right the star reads a book by the French windows

The home was built in 1957 and has four spacious bedrooms and four completely updated bathrooms.

The backyard has a lush garden with mature trees and a healthy lawn as well as a swimming pool.

Michele showed the house off to InStyle magazine in 2016 - her friend Estee Stanley decorated the home.

Good deal: The Brunette Bombshell author - who hails from the Bronx and got her start on Broadway - purchased the stunning 3,163-square-foot home in 2015 for under $3M

Rich neighbors: It's located in Brentwood's Mandeville Canyon area where Reese Witherspoon and Gwyneth Paltrow have homes

'I fell in love with this place the minute I saw it, just being so far from people and really being in nature and in the mountains,' said the

'It's spacious and you see so much green. This house is healing,' she said.

'I'm a homebody,' she says. 'I'm not a party girl. I've never been that. Trust me, I love to go out and share a nice bottle of wine with some friends over a delicious meal, but my perfect night is at home with people I love.'

Trendy hood: The canyon is deep and filled with mansions that can cost up to $40M. The area is about three miles from the beach

Nifty 50s: The home was built in 1957 and has four spacious bedrooms and four completely updated bathrooms

Nice white and grey tones: Michele showed the house off to InStyle magazine in 2016 - her friend Estee Stanley decorated the home

Home gal: 'I'm a homebody,' she says. 'I'm not a party girl. I've never been that. Trust me, I love to go out and share a nice bottle of wine with some friends over a delicious meal, but my perfect night is at home with people I love'

A lot of marble: There is a double sink with a self standing bath tub and a spa steam shower

Dreamy tub time: In this image Michele wears a pink dress while by her big white tub

She told the publication she has a big music collection.

'Some of my records were passed down to me from my parents, but the Barbras and Judys are mine,' Michele said in InStyle's Home & Design issue.

Her favorite is Barbra Streisand. 'Obviously, anytime I can go to a record store, if I find a Barbra, I take it.'

The star may want a bigger space because she is now married to fashion executive Zandy Reich.

The listing is held by Justin Paul Huchel at Hilton & Hyland.

Great party space: The backyard has a lush garden with mature trees and a healthy lawn as well as a swimming pool

The garage: There is plenty of room for her luxury cars as there is a double garage
description: The Brunette Bombshell author who hails from the Bronx purchased the stunning 3,163-square-foot home in 2015 for under $3M.
